1.text: Is there not an appointed time to man on earth? are not his days also like the days of an hireling?

2.text: As a servant earnestly desires the shadow, and as an hireling looks for the reward of his work:

3.text: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

4.text: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro to the dawning of the day.

5.text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

6.text: My days are swifter than a weaverâ€™s shuttle, and are spent without hope.

7.text: O remember that my life is wind: my eye shall no more see good.

8.text: The eye of him that has seen me shall see me no more: your eyes are on me, and I am not.

9.text: As the cloud is consumed and vanishes away: so he that goes down to the grave shall come up no more.

10.text: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.

11.text: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

12.text: Am I a sea, or a whale, that you set a watch over me?

13.text: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaints;

14.text: Then you scare me with dreams, and terrify me through visions:

15.text: So that my soul chooses strangling, and death rather than my life.

16.text: I loathe it; I would not live always: let me alone; for my days are vanity.

17.text: What is man, that you should magnify him? and that you should set your heart on him?

18.text: And that you should visit him every morning, and try him every moment?

19.text: How long will you not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?

20.text: I have sinned; what shall I do to you, O you preserver of men? why have you set me as a mark against you, so that I am a burden to myself?

21.text: And why do you not pardon my transgression, and take away my iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and you shall seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.
